medications.name: Aspirin
pearls: Prefer chewable for loading; consider PPI with DAPT if GI risk.

medications.name: P2Y12 inhibitor (ticagrelor/clopidogrel/prasugrel)

inpatient.load: Per strategy (e.g., ticagrelor 180 mg PO once)

pearls: Choose agent per PCI/lysis strategy and bleeding risk.

medications.name: Heparin (UFH) / Fondaparinux
pearls: Select per renal function/strategy; monitor closely.

medications.name: High‑intensity statin

outpatient.maint: Atorvastatin 40–80 mg or Rosuvastatin 20–40 mg daily

pearls: Check lipids; counsel on myalgias; consider drug interactions.

medications.name: Evidence‑based β‑blocker

outpatient.maint: Carvedilol, metoprolol succinate, or bisoprolol; titrate to HR/BP

avoid: Acute decompensated HF with shock/pulmonary edema
pearls: Initiate after stabilization in ACS/HF.

medications.name: Nitrates (SL nitroglycerin)

inpatient.prn: 0.4 mg SL q5min up to 3 doses for chest pain

pearls: Prefer SL early; topical/IV per BP and relief.

medications.name: Oxygen if hypoxic
pearls: Use only if hypoxic; target SpO2 per protocol.

medications.name: ARNI or ACEi/ARB

outpatient.maint: Sacubitril/valsartan preferred; otherwise ACEi/ARB per BP/renal function

pearls: Washout 36 h when switching ACEi → ARNI.

medications.name: Mineralocorticoid receptor antagonist

outpatient.maint: Spironolactone 12.5–25 mg daily; titrate

pearls: Monitor BMP/K+ within 1–2 weeks after changes.

medications.name: SGLT2 inhibitor

outpatient.maint: Dapagliflozin or empagliflozin 10 mg daily

pearls: Hold during severe illness/procedures; counsel on GU effects.

medications.name: Loop diuretic
pearls: Consider thiazide add‑on for diuretic resistance.

outpatient.maint: Select agent per comorbidity and BP

medications.name: ACE inhibitor or ARB

outpatient.maint: Lisinopril 10-40 mg daily or Losartan 50-100 mg daily

pearls: First-line for HTN; check K+ and creatinine after initiation.

medications.name: Thiazide/thiazide-like diuretic

outpatient.maint: Hydrochlorothiazide 25-50 mg daily or Chlorthalidone 25 mg daily

pearls: Preferred diuretic for HTN; monitor electrolytes.

medications.name: Calcium channel blocker

outpatient.maint: Amlodipine 5-10 mg daily or Nifedipine XL 30-60 mg daily

pearls: Effective for HTN; watch for peripheral edema.

medications.name: Warfarin

outpatient.maint: Dose to INR 2.0-3.0 with regular monitoring

pearls: Requires frequent INR monitoring; many drug interactions.

medications.name: Direct oral anticoagulant (DOAC)

outpatient.maint: Apixaban 5 mg BID, Rivaroxaban 20 mg daily, or Dabigatran 150 mg BID

pearls: Preferred over warfarin for most patients; dose adjust for renal function.

medications.name: Diltiazem

inpatient.maint: Immediate-release 30-90 mg QID or extended-release per formulation

outpatient.maint: Extended-release 120-360 mg daily

pearls: Effective for rate control in atrial fibrillation.

medications.name: Metoprolol

outpatient.maint: Metoprolol succinate 50-200 mg daily

pearls: Rate control for atrial fibrillation; use succinate form for HF.

medications.name: Digoxin

outpatient.maint: 0.125-0.25 mg daily with level monitoring

pearls: Monitor digoxin levels; narrow therapeutic window.

medications.name: NSAID (ibuprofen)
pearls: Use with PPI for GI protection; monitor renal function.

medications.name: Colchicine
pearls: For pericarditis; monitor for GI toxicity.

medications.name: Prednisone
pearls: Use for refractory pericarditis; taper slowly.

medications.name: IV Fluid Resuscitation
pearls: For tamponade stabilization; monitor hemodynamics.

medications.name: ACE Inhibitors

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: First-line for HTN and HF; monitor K+ and creatinine; cough common side effect.

medications.name: ACE Inhibitor/Diuretic Combinations

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: Convenient combination for HTN; monitor electrolytes closely.

medications.name: Angiotensin II Receptor Blockers (ARBs)

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: Alternative to ACEi if cough; monitor K+ and creatinine; less cough than ACEi.

medications.name: ARB/Diuretic Combinations

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: Convenient combination for HTN; monitor electrolytes and renal function.

medications.name: Beta Blockers

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to HR/BP goal

pearls: Rate control for AF/atrial flutter; evidence-based for HF/ACS; fatigue common.

medications.name: Beta Blocker/Diuretic Combinations

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to HR/BP goal

pearls: Convenient combination; monitor electrolytes and renal function.

medications.name: Non-Dihydropyridine Calcium Channel Blockers
medications: Diltiazem (Cardizem, Cardizem LA, Cardizem CD, Cartia XT, Dilacor XR, Diltzac, Diltia XT, Taztia XT, Tiazac)

outpatient.maint: Diltiazem 120-360 mg daily; Verapamil 120-480 mg daily

pearls: Effective for rate control in AF; negative inotrope; constipation with verapamil.

medications.name: Dihydropyridine Calcium Channel Blockers
medications: Nifedipine (Adalat, Procardia, Procardia XL, Adalat CC)

outpatient.maint: Amlodipine 5-10 mg daily; others per formulation

pearls: Effective for HTN; peripheral edema common; amlodipine preferred for HF.

medications.name: Direct Renin Inhibitors

outpatient.maint: Aliskiren 150-300 mg daily

pearls: Less commonly used; monitor K+ and creatinine; avoid with ACEi/ARB.

medications.name: Heart Failure Medications

outpatient.maint: Per agent dosing; titrate to symptoms

pearls: BiDil for African Americans with HF; ivabradine for HFrEF with HR >70; Entresto preferred over ACEi.

medications.name: Aldosterone Antagonists

outpatient.maint: Spironolactone 12.5-50 mg daily; Eplerenone 25-50 mg daily

pearls: Monitor K+ closely; gynecomastia with spironolactone; evidence-based for HFrEF.

medications.name: Antiadrenergic Agents

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: Second-line for HTN; clonidine for rebound HTN; methyldopa for pregnancy HTN.

medications.name: Diuretics

outpatient.maint: Titrate to symptoms/weight; monitor electrolytes

pearls: Loop diuretics first-line for HF; monitor renal function and electrolytes.

medications.name: Thiazide Diuretics

outpatient.maint: 12.5-50 mg daily; titrate to BP goal

pearls: First-line for HTN; monitor electrolytes; chlorthalidone may be more effective.

medications.name: ACE Inhibitor/CCB Combinations

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: Convenient dual mechanism for HTN; monitor K+ and creatinine.

medications.name: CCB/Direct Renin Inhibitor Combinations

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: Triple mechanism for resistant HTN; monitor K+ and creatinine.

medications.name: CCB/Direct Renin Inhibitor/Diuretic Combinations

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: Quadruple mechanism for resistant HTN; monitor electrolytes closely.

medications.name: ARB/CCB Combinations

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: Dual mechanism for HTN; less cough than ACEi; monitor K+.

medications.name: ARB/CCB/Diuretic Combinations

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: Triple mechanism for HTN; convenient combination; monitor electrolytes.

medications.name: Vasodilator/Diuretic Combinations

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: For HTN in African Americans; monitor for drug-induced lupus.

medications.name: Potassium-Sparing Diuretic Combinations

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to BP goal

pearls: Spare potassium while providing diuresis; monitor K+ closely.

medications.name: Anticoagulants

outpatient.maint: Per agent dosing; monitor per protocol

pearls: DOACs preferred over warfarin for most; warfarin requires INR monitoring.

medications.name: Antiplatelets

outpatient.maint: Per agent dosing; aspirin 81-325 mg daily

pearls: Aspirin first-line for primary prevention; dual therapy for ACS/PCI.

medications.name: Other Anticoagulants

outpatient.maint: Per agent dosing

pearls: Vorapaxar for secondary prevention; cilostazol for PAD; pentoxifylline for claudication.

medications.name: Antiarrhythmics

outpatient.maint: Per agent dosing; monitor ECG/QT

pearls: Class-specific indications; monitor for proarrhythmia; many drug interactions.

medications.name: Nitrates

outpatient.maint: Per formulation; apply patch 12-14 hrs/day with 12 hr break

pearls: For angina; tolerance develops with continuous exposure; headache common.

medications.name: Other Anti-Angina Agents
pearls: For chronic angina; prolongs QT interval; use with other antianginals.

medications.name: Bile Acid Sequestrants

outpatient.maint: Per agent dosing; take with meals

pearls: Lower LDL; may increase triglycerides; take with other lipid-lowering agents.

medications.name: EPA/Omega-3 Fatty Acids

outpatient.maint: Per agent dosing

pearls: Lower triglycerides; Vascepa reduces CV events in high-risk patients.

medications.name: Statins (HMG-CoA Reductase Inhibitors)

outpatient.maint: Start low dose, titrate to LDL goal

pearls: First-line for dyslipidemia; monitor LFTs; muscle toxicity rare but serious.

medications.name: PCSK9 Inhibitors

outpatient.maint: Per agent dosing; subcutaneous injection

pearls: For severe hypercholesterolemia; very effective LDL reduction; expensive.

medications.name: Fibrates

outpatient.maint: Per agent dosing; take with food

pearls: Lower triglycerides; may increase LDL; monitor LFTs and CK.

medications.name: Niacin

outpatient.maint: 500-2000 mg daily; titrate slowly

pearls: Lowers LDL and triglycerides; flushing common; monitor LFTs.

medications.name: ACL Inhibitors

outpatient.maint: Per agent dosing

pearls: For LDL lowering; oral alternative to injectable PCSK9 inhibitors.

medications.name: Lipid-Lowering Combinations

outpatient.maint: Per combination dosing

pearls: Convenient combinations; monitor LFTs and side effects of components.
